greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The terms of A308007 appear to lie on two lines; set a(n) = 0 if A308007(n) is on the lower line (defined by A308009(n) <= n), a(n) = 1 if it is on the upper line (defined by a(n) >= n).
comment: The first six terms of A308007 lie on both lines, so a(n) for n <= 6 is both 0 and 1.
More than the usual number of terms are given in order to show the irregularities.
It is only a (strong) conjecture that the terms of A308007 line on two lines. Certainly this is true for the first million terms.
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 15 2019
